column4: help please...-> installed 10.04 fine. now i need to get the raid card recognized. found the card in the dmesg, but it's listed as scsi7.. when i was expecting it to have like a sda1 or something. does that mean the bios sees it but a driver has not been loaded, or...?
dmesg will find everything by default. Doesn't mean its configured
if you run: lspci ,you will see the chip it uses and you can find guides using that. You may just see your drives with: sudo fdisk -l ,in which case you are good to go
Thanks. the raid card was listed in lspci, and "sudo fdisk -l" also showed it, (so yay!, right?)
